docs.snippet: The EU rebuffed a call from pro-Brexit British MPs for a quick deal on mutual residence rights for British and EU expatriates, telling them on Tuesday it was up to their government to launch full-blown divorce talks....
docs.lead_paragraph: The EU rebuffed a call from pro-Brexit British MPs for a quick deal on mutual residence rights for British and EU expatriates, telling them on Tuesday it was up to their government to launch full-blown divorce talks.

headline.main: EU Rebuffs Call to Start Brexit Talks on Expat Rights
headline.print_headline: EU Rebuffs Call to Start Brexit Talks on Expat Rights

docs.snippet: The European Union will unveil its biggest defense research plan in more than a decade on Wednesday to reverse billions of euros in cuts and send a message to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump that Europe wants to pay for its own security....
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Union will unveil its biggest defense research plan in more than a decade on Wednesday to reverse billions of euros in cuts and send a message to U.S. President-elect Donald Trump that Europe wants to pay for its own security.

headline.main: After Trump and Brexit, EU to Launch Defense Research Plan
headline.print_headline: After Trump and Brexit, EU to Launch Defense Research Plan

headline.main: When Does Brexit Mean Brexit: Could the UK Change Its Mind?

docs.snippet: Sweden will side with the rest of the European Union in talks with Britain about leaving the bloc, the Swedish minister for EU affairs and trade said on Tuesday, ending any hope Britain would get any special favor from one of its closest EU allies...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sweden will side with the rest of the European Union in talks with Britain about leaving the bloc, the Swedish minister for EU affairs and trade said on Tuesday, ending any hope Britain would get any special favor from one of its closest EU allies.

headline.main: Britain's Long-Time Ally Sweden Sides With EU on Brexit
headline.print_headline: Britain's Long-Time Ally Sweden Sides With EU on Brexit

headline.main: German Confident EU27 Will Stick Together in Brexit Talks
headline.print_headline: German Confident EU27 Will Stick Together in Brexit Talks

docs.snippet: Over thirty percent of British hedge funds say they are uncertain about remaining in the UK following Britain's vote to leave the European Union according to an industry survey, a larger proportion than immediately after the referendum....
docs.lead_paragraph: Over thirty percent of British hedge funds say they are uncertain about remaining in the UK following Britain's vote to leave the European Union according to an industry survey, a larger proportion than immediately after the referendum.

headline.main: More British Hedge Funds Say May Have to Move After Brexit-Preqin
headline.print_headline: More British Hedge Funds Say May Have to Move After Brexit-Preqin

docs.snippet: Large banks in Britain want the UK government to allow their industry to remain subject to EU laws for up to five years after Brexit, a move likely to enrage eurosceptics who want to break away from the bloc's legal system as soon as possible. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: Large banks in Britain want the UK government to allow their industry to remain subject to EU laws for up to five years after Brexit, a move likely to enrage eurosceptics who want to break away from the bloc's legal system as soon as possible. The banks - international players - are also pressing the government to allow the European Court of Justice to rule on decisions related to their businesses during that period, according to a document reviewed by Reuters.

headline.main: Exclusive: Banks Want to Be Subject to EU Laws for Five Years in Post-Brexit Deal
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Banks Want to Be Subject to EU Laws for Five Years in Post-Brexit Deal

docs.snippet: Britain's Supreme Court will decide as quickly as possible whether Prime Minister Theresa May can trigger Britain's exit from the European Union by the end of March without parliament's assent, its president said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Supreme Court will decide as quickly as possible whether Prime Minister Theresa May can trigger Britain's exit from the European Union by the end of March without parliament's assent, its president said on Thursday.

headline.main: UK Supreme Court to Decide Brexit Trigger Case as Quickly as Possible
headline.print_headline: UK Supreme Court to Decide Brexit Trigger Case as Quickly as Possible

docs.snippet: “Brexit could mean fewer JPMorgan jobs in the U.K. and more jobs in Europe,” Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase's chief executive, said. The bank employs 16,000 staff in Britain....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Brexit could mean fewer JPMorgan jobs in the U.K. and more jobs in Europe,” Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase's chief executive, said. The bank employs 16,000 staff in Britain.

headline.main: JPMorgan Warns of a Brexit Jobs Cut
